title: Technology-Supported Collaborative Problem-Based Learning and Peer Assessment Competency Enhancement Course

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of foundational scientific theories and experimental methods, with basic digital tool proficiency
context.additional_context: Development of collaborative problem-solving and peer-assessment competencies applicable in science education contexts.

learning_goals: Learners can perform the process of solving science problems through collaborative problem-based learning (PBL) in technology-supported environments with over 80% accuracy
Learners can evaluate peers' science projects by systematically applying feedback methods and criteria during peer assessment
Learners can record and analyze conflict situations arising during science problem-solving processes in five or more stages using online collaboration tools, then derive improvement strategies
Learners can write self-assessment reports evaluating participation in PBL activities and the usefulness of peer feedback in digital device-supported environments

resources: Online collaboration tools (Google Workspace, Padlet, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
